#Text=2. Literature
#Text=Review
#Text=This paper tackles the joint price and greenness decisions of the finance-constrained supply chain .

#Text=Three streams of literature are related with our work , namely , green supply chain management ( GSCM ) , green supply chain collaboration and coordination , and emerging enterprises ’ operational strategies under financial constraints .
#Text=Mathu pointed that when focusing on lean and agile supply chains , closed-loop supply chains , reverse logistics , and the practice of just in time , the operation is transformed to GSCM .
#Text=GSCM can be seen as an environmental innovation , which integrates environmental thinking into supply chain management ( SCM ) .
#Text=It aims to minimize or eliminate wastages including hazardous chemical , energy and emissions along supply chain .
#Text=As reviewed by Ashby et al. , Green product development has been long recognized as one of the main themes in GSCM .
#Text=Enterprises apply tools such as design for environment , design for disassemble , and life cycle analysis in order to reduce the product ’s environmental impact .
#Text=It is believed that enterprises implementing GSCM practices can benefit from cost savings , better public image and decreased environmental liability .

#Text=What is more , it is supported that GSCM is closely related to the participants ’ financial performance . Feng et al. suggest that GSCM as an integral supply chain strategy is positively associated with both environmental and financial performance .

#Text=Flammer finds that enterprises ’ ecofriendly behavior is closely related to significant stock price increases , whereas enterprises with eco-harmful behavior face decreases in stock price . Zhang et al.
#Text=proposes social control as an effective mechanism to strengthen the impact of GSCM on enterprises ’ financial performance .
#Text=Following these researches , this paper pays attention to the green products , investigates the relationship between product greenness and the enterprises ’ utilities .

#Text=Different from previous literatures , this paper considers not only the relationship between product greenness and the enterprise ’ profits , but also the relationship between product greenness and the finance-constrained enterprise ’s survival probability .

#Text=Among the issues in GSCM , collaboration is the most important . Chin et al. indicate that environmental collaboration is a key relational capability to facilitate the GSCM strategic formulation and execution .
#Text=Further , from the perspective of supply chain coordination and the development of economic models , green supply chain coordinating issues are also developed and discussed widely .
#Text=Zhang and Liu study the decisions in a three-level supply chain with market demand and product greenness related .

#Text=It is pointed out that revenue-sharing mechanism , Shapley-value coordination mechanism , and asymmetric Nash negotiation mechanism can all improve the performance in a decentralized supply chain .
#Text=Zhu and He introduce quality ( greenness ) as a decision variable , and study the green product design in the competitive supply chain .

#Text=Ghosh and Shah compare the pricing , greenness , and supply chain revenue in the decentralized channel structure , and propose that two-part tariff contracts can coordinate the green supply chain and cooperation can improve product greenness .

#Text=Ghosh and Shah study the manufacturer-retailer supply chain where consumers have preference for greenness , and find that cooperation with cost-sharing contracts can improve the greenness and revenue of supply chains , but bargaining between manufacturer and retailer would not increase the retailer ’s revenue .
#Text=Swami and Shah focus on channel conflicts between manufacturers and retailers in green supply chains , and study coordination problems among green supply chain members .

#Text=Contributing to this stream of literatures , this paper ( i ) constructs a two-stage cooperative analytical framework between the supplier and the manufacturer for the long-term , and cross-stage R & D process of green products ; ( ii ) examines the impact of investment-sharing contract on green innovation in the sustainable supply chain cooperation .
#Text=Recently , an increasing of scholars have paid attention to the emerging enterprises ’ operational strategies under financial constraints .
#Text=Babich argues that only when the enterprises survive in the market , can they make profits in the long term .
#Text=Under the financial constraints , the emerging enterprises would be exposed to bankruptcy risk , should the market fail as expected .
#Text=Therefore , studies on emerging enterprises ’ innovating activities also focus on the emerging enterprises ’ survival probability .

#Text=According to Cefis and Marsili , emerging enterprises can increase their survival probability through innovations . Criscuolo et al. find that emerging enterprises in the service industry have a higher probability of innovation .
#Text=In contrast , Shane finds that most emerging enterprises start from ordinary industries without special creativity .
#Text=Bhidé argues that only 6 % of the giant enterprises began by offering unique products or services , while 58 % began by offering alternatives of existing products and services .

#Text=Thus , different from the empirical researches , this paper ( i ) adopts a two-stage analytical framework to conduct theoretical researches on green innovation decisions of the emerging enterprises , and ( ii ) expands the research of financial constraints from a single enterprise level into the supply chain level .
